title: How CEOs of Microsoft, Google, Palo Alto Bought an English Cricket Team
body:
Late last year, Nikesh Arora , billionaire CEO of cybersecurity firm Palo Alto Networks , was hanging out in his California home with his friend, vice chairman of Indian tech conglomerate Times Internet, Satyan Gajwani , when the pair got to talking about cricket.

Gajwani is a co-founder of Major League Cricket, a US league that launched in 2023. Arora has a stake in one of its teams. They were discussing ways to grow the business when Gajwani mentioned another upstart tournament, which had just begun looking for capital on the other side of the Atlantic. They called some more friends: Satya Nadella , Microsoft Inc.’s CEO, Sundar Pichai , the head of Google parent Alphabet Inc., and Shantanu Narayen , who runs Adobe Inc.
summary:
* Major League Cricket is a US-based cricket league that launched in 2023.
* Satyan Gajwani, vice chairman of Indian tech conglomerate Times Internet, is a co-founder of Major League Cricket.
* Nikesh Arora, billionaire CEO of Palo Alto Networks, has a stake in one of the teams in the league.

title: MLC Retentions 2025: Netravalkar to Unmukt Chand – List of Domestic Players Retained Ahead of Major League Cricket Draft
body:
oi-Mark Hoover

MLC Retentions 2025: Major League Cricket teams have started revealing their retention list, starting with domestic retained players ahead of the domestic player draft, which is set to take place on Wednesday (February 19).

While Washington Freedom, Los Angeles Knight Riders, and San Francisco Unicorns have opted to retain almost full quota of their domestic contingent, MI New York, Texas Super Kings, and Seattle Orcas, have preferred to let go half of their domestic roster.

Top American stars like Saurabh Netravalkar, Andries Gous, Aaron Jones, Ali Khan, Umukt Chand and Corey Anderson among others were the domestic talents retained ahead of the Major League Cricket season 3.

United States opening batter Steven Taylor, their first-ever draft pick back in 2023, was among the players released. Shehan Jayasuriya, Nauman Anwar, Hammad Azam, Shahyan Jahangir and Shubham Ranjane were also let go. Here is a look at the domestic retained players ahead of MLC 2025 Draft:

MLC 2025 Retentions - List of Domestic Players Retained Ahead of Domestic Draft

Los Angeles Knight Riders 2025 Retained Players: Ali Khan, Adithya Ganesh, Unmukt Chand, Nitish Kumar, Corne Dry, Saif Badar, Shadley van Schalkwyk, Matthew Tromp

MI New York 2025 Retained Players: Ehsan Adit, Nosthush Kenjige, Monank Patel, Heath Richards, Rushil Ugarkar, Sunny Patel

San Francisco 2025 Retained Players: Corey Anderson, Hassan Khan, Liam Plunkett, Carmi le Roux, Sanjay Krishnamurthi, Brody Couch, Karima Gore, Juan Drysdale

Seattle Orcas 2025 Retained Players: Harmeet Singh, Aaron Jones, Ayan Desai, Cameron Gannon, Ali Sheikh

Texas Super Kings 2025 Retained Players: Joshua Tromp, Calvin Savage, Milind Kumar, Mohammad Mohsin, Zia-ul-Haq, Saiteja Mukkamalla

Washington Freedom 2025 Retained Players: Andries Gous, Saurabh Netravalkar, Mukhtar Ahmed, Amila Aponso, Obus Pienaar, Justin Dill, Ian Holland, Lahiru Milantha, Yasir Mohammad

MLC 2025 Remaining Purse For Draft

Seattle Orcas hold the largest purse heading into the drafting process with USD 180,000 of their USD 320,000 left in their domestic purse. MI New York, who released their top picks from the past two seasons, have next biggest domestic purse remaining at USD 160,000.

Texas Super Kings also have a remaining purse of USD 100,000, while Washington Freedom, Los Angeles Knight Riders and San Francisco Unicorns head into the domestic draft 2025 with the smallest purse. Here is a look at the remaining purse:
summary:
**Retention List**: Major League Cricket teams have announced their domestic retained players ahead of the domestic player draft on February 19. The retained players include top American stars such as Saurabh Netravalkar, Andries Gous, Aaron Jones, Ali Khan, Umukt Chand, and Corey Anderson.

**Retention Breakdown**: Washington Freedom, Los Angeles Knight Riders, and San Francisco Unicorns have retained almost their full quota of domestic players, while MI New York, Texas Super Kings, and Seattle Orcas have released half of their domestic roster.

**Notable Releases**: Steven Taylor, Shehan Jayasuriya, Nauman Anwar, Hammad Azam, Shahyan Jahangir, and Shubham Ranjane are among the players released by their teams.

**Team-wise Retention List**: The article provides a detailed list of retained domestic players for each team, including Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom.

**Remaining Purse for Draft**: Seattle Orcas have the largest remaining purse for the draft at USD 180,000, followed by MI New York at USD 160,000. Texas Super Kings have a remaining purse of USD 100,000, while Washington Freedom, Los Angeles Knight Riders, and San Francisco Unicorns have the smallest remaining purse.

title: MLC Domestic Retentions: Taylor, Jayasuriya, Jahangir & Ranjane head to draft
body:
by Smit Patel • Last updated on

LAKR, MI NY and SF Unicorns domestic rosters. © Cricbuzz

The Major League Cricket teams have announced their domestic player retention lists ahead of the domestic player draft, set to take place on February 19. While teams like Washington Freedom, Los Angeles Knight Riders, and San Francisco Unicorns have opted to retain almost all of their domestic contingent, others, such as MI New York, Texas Super Kings, and Seattle Orcas, have chosen to offload nearly half of their domestic rosters.

Seattle Orcas enter the draft with the highest remaining purse of USD 180,000 after releasing several high-profile former internationals, including Shehan Jayasuriya, Nauman Anwar, and Hammad Azam. Reports suggest that Jayasuriya may have requested an early release from his contract after being benched during the early stages of last year's tournament due to fitness concerns, particularly regarding his weight.

Another unexpected non-retention was star all-rounder Shubham Ranjane. Despite his talent, Ranjane was largely underutilised by the Orcas, which may have prompted him to enter the player draft. Furthermore, he is widely expected to be the league's number-one draft pick, a move that would grant the Maharashtra-born all-rounder a 50 percent pay hike.

MI New York made a bold decision by parting ways with Steven Taylor, their first-ever draft pick back in 2023. The franchise initially took a leap of faith on Taylor's T20 potential but ultimately lost patience after two underwhelming seasons with the bat.

SO, TSK and WF rosters ©Cricbuzz

Another significant omission was USA wicketkeeper-batsman Shayan Jahangir. The news comes as a double setback for Jahangir, who is already dealing with visa issues that prevented him from participating in the ongoing ODI tri-series in Oman. Additionally, Ruben Clinton, MI's top pick in last year's domestic draft, was also released following a string of low scores at the top of the order.

Texas Super Kings' Raj Nannan, another former number-one draft pick, was also let go. However, the left-arm spinner may feel hard done by, having been dropped without getting a single game. The Super Kings further parted ways with former Pakistan first-class leg-spinner Zia Shehzad, who played just one match during his two-season stint with the franchise.

Teams like Washington Freedom, Los Angeles Knight Riders, and San Francisco Unicorns are unlikely to make significant moves in the draft, with only USD 15,000, USD 10,000, and USD 10,000, respectively, remaining from their USD 320,000 domestic purse. However, the draft promises to be a high-stakes affair for MI New York, Texas Super Kings, and Seattle Orcas, as they look to rebuild after shedding nearly half of their domestic squads. They enter the draft with remaining purses of USD 160,000, USD 100,000, and USD 180,000, respectively.

© Cricbuzz

ShareTweet

title: ECB assures no barriers for Pakistan players in The Hundred despite IPL influence
body:
Pakistan cricketers will not face restrictions in The Hundred despite the influence of IPL franchise owners, according to the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB).

While Pakistani players have been absent from IPL-affiliated leagues like SA20, ILT20 and Major League Cricket (MLC), they have consistently featured in The Hundred, reinforcing the tournament’s "best versus best" approach.

Despite IPL franchise owners comprising half of the new investors in The Hundred, the ECB does not anticipate India’s male cricketers being made available for the tournament.

Additionally, the board does not foresee any obstacles preventing Pakistani players from participating in England’s flagship competition.

On Thursday, the ECB confirmed that it had entered into exclusivity agreements with eight partners to secure private investment for each of The Hundred's teams, with a total valuation exceeding £975 million.

These investors now enter an eight-week negotiation period with the host counties.

Among the new investors are RPSG Group (owners of Lucknow Super Giants), Sun TV Network Limited (Sunrisers Hyderabad), Reliance Industries Limited (Mumbai Indians) and GMR Group (co-owners of Delhi Capitals).

They have successfully bid for Manchester Originals, Northern Superchargers, Oval Invincibles and Southern Brave, respectively.

While the ECB has achieved its objective of attracting diverse investors, there is a prevailing belief that the involvement of high-profile IPL stakeholders will help unlock the lucrative Indian market.

However, the ECB does not expect these new ties to influence the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) to lift its restrictions on active Indian male players participating in overseas T20 leagues.

Although several Indian cricketers have played county cricket, none have featured in the men’s Hundred or the T20 Blast.

Speaking on the issue, ECB Chief Executive Richard Gould clarified that The Hundred's expansion does not factor in the participation of Indian players.

"In terms of the India TV market, the overseas market is very important for us," ECB Chief Executive Richard Gould said.

"The fact that we have got such a wide-ranging set of investors from around the globe will, I believe, help us add extra value to our overseas broadcast rights.

"In terms of availability for Indian players, that is not factored into our plans. The BCCI's position has been very clear. At some point, we'd love to see Indian players come and play in England.

We currently see them in bilaterals and quite a lot in county cricket. But that’s not something we have predetermined through this process."

Gould also reassured that Pakistani cricketers would not face restrictions in The Hundred due to IPL influence.

Since 2008, no Pakistani players have participated in the IPL due to political tensions between India and Pakistan, though no formal directive has been issued by the BCCI.

"We are aware of the challenges Pakistani players face in other regions, but that won’t be happening here," Gould stated, confirming the ECB's stance on maintaining inclusivity.

The ECB also hopes that closer collaboration with IPL franchise owners will eventually secure The Hundred a dedicated window in the global cricket calendar.

Previously, the tournament has overlapped with the MLC and the Caribbean Premier League (CPL), leading to conflicts over player availability.

This year, the MLC will conclude before The Hundred, but there remains a two-week overlap with the CPL.

Three of The Hundred’s new investors—Reliance (MI New York), GMR (Seattle Orcas) and Welsh Fire's prospective 50% co-owner Sanjay Govil (Washington Freedom)—are also involved in the MLC.

With former Professional Cricketers' Association commercial director Johnny Grave now serving as the CEO of The Hundred, the ECB sees potential for better coordination of scheduling.

Vikram Banerjee, the ECB’s director of business operations, highlighted the advantages of aligning The Hundred’s schedule with other global T20 leagues.

"One of the advantages that we have with our setup is that there's a connection with the majority of other cricket leagues around the world," Banerjee, who oversaw the Hundred sale, said.

"And for all of those [T20] leagues, it makes little sense for any of us to clash if we can avoid it.

"So we are now on the same side, if you like, and we can have sensible conversations going forward. For the MLC, that includes the fact that we obviously know the new CEO there pretty well.

"But for us, it's about ensuring that we can make The Hundred a real success in our window by getting the best players, and clashes make that hard. So we'll do our best to avoid it. And I think all the people coming in understand that."
summary:
* The MLC is mentioned as one of the leagues that Pakistani cricketers have been absent from, along with SA20 and ILT20.
* The article highlights that three of The Hundred's new investors - Reliance (MI New York), GMR (Seattle Orcas), and Welsh Fire's prospective 50% co-owner Sanjay Govil (Washington Freedom) - are also involved in the MLC.
* The MLC is mentioned as a conflicting tournament with The Hundred, with a two-week overlap this year. However, the ECB hopes to secure a dedicated window in the global cricket calendar for The Hundred, and avoid clashes with other T20 leagues, including the MLC.
* The ECB's director of business operations, Vikram Banerjee, mentions that having investors involved in both The Hundred and the MLC can facilitate "sensible conversations" to avoid clashes and ensure the success of both tournaments.

title: Will Pakistan cricketers face the heat as IPL teams join The Hundred? Here’s what the ECB said
body:
From Major League Cricket in the USA to SA20 teams in South Africa, IPL franchises have already expanded to these places. Now, England’s famous league, The Hundred, will have Indian co-owners for fifty percent of the teams, with four out of the eight teams now co-owned by franchises that also own IPL teams. Adding to this, GMR has acquired a 100% stake in Southern Brave, which means they now have full control over this The Hundred team.

Amidst all this, one question on everyone’s mind is whether IPL-owned teams will avoid picking Pakistani players. This is largely due to various factors. In SA20, the league usually coincides with the PSL, while Major League Cricket does have Pakistani players, but only in teams not owned by IPL franchises. This makes the situation even more interesting.

Now, with IPL team owners buying stakes in this popular tournament, will there be any restrictions or limitations on Pakistani players? The answer is already coming from England and Wales Cricket Board chief executive Richard Gould. According to ESPN Cricinfo, he clarified, “We’re aware of that in other regions, but that won’t be happening here.”

Will Indian cricketers play in The Hundred?

Gould also opened up about the availability of Indian players. As per the BCCI, they don’t allow active Indian cricketers to play in other leagues to protect them from injury and over-exposure. The ECB chief executive spoke along similar lines but mentioned that he would be happy to see Indian players participating in such leagues.

“In terms of availability to Indian players, that is not priced in with our plans. The BCCI’s position has been very clear. At some point, we’d love to see Indian players come and play in England. We currently see them obviously in bilaterals and actually quite a lot in county cricket. But that’s not something that we have predetermined through this process.”

IPL team owners with stakes in The Hundred
summary:
* IPL franchise owners have acquired stakes in The Hundred, a popular English cricket tournament, with four out of eight teams now co-owned by IPL franchises, including GMR's 100% stake in Southern Brave.
* There is concern about whether IPL-owned teams will pick Pakistani players, given their absence in SA20 and their limited presence in Major League Cricket, but England and Wales Cricket Board chief executive Richard Gould has clarified that there will be no restrictions on Pakistani players in The Hundred.
* Indian cricketers are unlikely to participate in The Hundred due to the BCCI's policy of not allowing active Indian cricketers to play in other leagues, although Gould expressed hope that Indian players will participate in the future.

title: Baseball versus Cricket in North America
body:
Major League Cricket’s Washington Freedom celebrate their title win in 2024

There’s a famous Pub Quiz question which asks which two teams competed in the inaugural international cricket match. Surprisingly, the answer is United States versus Canada (in 1844). So what happened to cricket in North America in the subsequent years, and how did baseball come to overtake it in popularity in that part of the world?

It is said that it was in part a victim of the US Civil War (1861 to 1865) and was by this time seen as a gentlemen’s game rather than the blue collar game which baseball was to become.

Once the Imperial Cricket Conference was formed in 1909 comprising Australia, England and South Africa it was said that the next team in the world were the Gentlemen of Philadelphia – but they were not, of course, an international team and time marched on with other countries joining what became the International Cricket Council and cricket waning in popularity in North America.

With the commencement of Twenty20 (T20) Cricket by the England and Wales Cricket Board in 2003 and the Indian Premier League in 2008, franchise competitions around the world have given opportunities for the best cricketers to be seen (and rewarded) outside their home countries.

In 2023, Major League Cricket began in the USA comprising six teams: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings and Washington Freedom with matches held at just two venues: Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas (capacity 7,200) and Morrisville, North Carolina (capacity 3,500).

While there are plans to build new or renovate existing venues the question remains about why, to date, cricket has never caught on sufficiently in North America especially given the huge popularity of baseball.

I have always thought that had history been different, T20 cricket in particular would be an ideal product for the North American Sports market. My rationale for this is that the other main North America sports (NFL and NBA) tend to be high scoring whilst a MLB game which lasts a similar length of time to a T20 match could potentially finish 1-0, while the latter can produce over 200 runs.

However, cricket in North America is seemingly always going to be a poor relative and competitor to baseball and additionally has the issues of all minority sports including the lack of adequate facilities, coaching, and marketing.

Where in the US children seem to grow up with a ball and glove in much the same way as UK kids do with a football – cricket equipment is expensive and the techniques are complicated in comparison with the hitting and throwing of a baseball.

Interestingly, the USA have recently entered a team in the Under 19 T20 Cricket World Cup having previously participated in the 2006 and 2010 tournaments. Hopefully, any success that the team has will have a positive impact on the prospects of the game in North America and help the game to grow in popularity by complementing rather than competing with baseball.

Article by Steve Boyde. Fancy writing for us? Get in touch here!
summary: The article highlights the recent success of the Washington Freedom in the 2024 Major League Cricket tournament. The tournament was launched in 2023 in the USA, featuring six teams: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom. The matches were held at two venues: Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and Morrisville, North Carolina. While there are plans to build new or renovate existing venues, the article questions why cricket has never caught on sufficiently in North America, despite the popularity of Twenty20 (T20) cricket globally.

title: Major League Cricket 2025 Schedule, Start Date, Venues, Teams List, Squads, League stage & Play-offs
body:
Major League Cricket is all set to come up with another thrilling, exciting edition of the tournament. The competition usually takes place in July, and all the participating teams give tough competition to each other.

The forthcoming edition of the Major League Cricket will be the third edition since its establishment in 2023. This tournament was introduced to give a platform and high-level stage to cricketers. Based in the United States.

In the previous edition of the Major League Cricket, many tough games took place. Cricket fans were thrilled to witness the final match where Washington Freedom overcame the opponent and won the match.

The American Cricket Enterprises is yet to announce the official start date of the upcoming Major League Cricket 2025. As per the previous edition, the tournament is most likely to take place in July, and the final will also take place in July.

Major League Cricket 2025 Schedule and Venue Details:

In the forthcoming edition, a total of 25 matches will take place, consisting of the main event final match. Very soon the official Schedule of the Major League Cricket 2025 will reveal. Also, at the end of July, USA Cricket fans will get to know the winner of the third edition of the Major League Cricket 2025.

All of the scheduled 25 fixtures will likely take place at two different venues in the United States. Morrisville and Grand Prairie are the two venues for the upcoming Major League Cricket 2025 competition.

Participating Team Details and Their Full Squad for the Major League Cricket 2025:

A total of six teams will be competing with each other for the title of the Major League Cricket 2025. Meanwhile, all of these six teams will represent the popular cities based in the United States in MLC 2025. After advancing through the round-robin stage, top-performing teams will play the Eliminator, Qualifier, and Challenger match in the playoff stage.

Washington Freedom

San Francisco Unicorns

Texas Super Kings

MI New York

Los Angeles Knight Riders

Seattle Orcas

Washington Freedom is all set to defend their title in the third edition of the Major League Cricket. In the previous season, they managed to defeat mighty San Francisco the Unicorns team by a huge margin of 96 runs. Steve Smith from Washington Freedom received the prestigious Player of the Match award. The official team squad of all six teams is yet to be revealed by the Administrators of MLC.

Major League Cricket 2025 League Stage and Play-Offs:

The Major League Cricket 2025 will follow the Round Robin and Playoffs format in 2025. So, all of the six teams will take on each other at the round-robin stage of the competition. The top two leading teams will get direct qualification for the qualifier, while the 3rd and 4th will face each other in the eliminator match.

After that, the loser of the qualifier and winner of the eliminator will play in a challenging game to decide the other finalists of the competition. The top two strongest teams of the season will play in the main event in the final match.
summary:
**Tournament Overview**
The third edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC) is set to take place in July 2025 in the United States. The tournament was established in 2023 to provide a platform for cricketers.

**Previous Edition**
The previous edition saw Washington Freedom win the title, defeating San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs in the final match.

**Upcoming Edition**
The MLC 2025 will feature six teams, each representing a popular US city, competing in 25 matches, including the final. The teams are: Washington Freedom, San Francisco Unicorns, Texas Super Kings, MI New York, Los Angeles Knight Riders, and Seattle Orcas. The tournament will follow a Round Robin and Playoffs format.

**Schedule and Venues**
The tournament is expected to take place in July, with the final scheduled for the end of July. The 25 matches will be held across two venues in the US: Morrisville and Grand Prairie.

**Title Defense**
Washington Freedom will defend their title in the upcoming edition, with Steve Smith having received the Player of the Match award in the previous season.

**Team Squads**
The official team squads for all six teams are yet to be announced by the MLC administrators.

title: ECB Shares Update on Pakistani Players in The Hundred Tournament
body:
Pakistani cricketers are not expected to face participation hurdles in The Hundred, despite the increasing involvement of IPL, ECB said.

Pakistani players have been absent from other IPL-affiliated leagues such as SA20, ILT20, and Major League Cricket (MLC).

However, they have regularly competed in The Hundred, which the ECB has sought to promote as a competition featuring the top players.

The ECB does not expect IPL franchise investments in The Hundred to change the stance of India on allowing its male cricketers to participate.

The ECB recently confirmed that it had secured agreements with eight private investors, valuing the tournament at over £975 million.

The cricket authority in England and Wales further added that these investors are set to enter talks with host counties over the coming weeks.

The investors include RPSG Group, Sun TV Network, Reliance Industries, and GMR Group, who have aligned with teams such as Manchester Originals and Oval Invincibles.

It is believed that their involvement could enhance broadcast value in India, though BCCI has not altered its policy barring active male players from overseas leagues.

ECB Chief Richard Gould said Indian player participation was not a factor in expansion and affirmed Pakistani cricketers remain welcome.

Officials suggested that collaboration with IPL owners could help prevent future scheduling clashes with global T20 competitions.
summary:
* Pakistani cricketers have been absent from MLC, along with other IPL-affiliated leagues such as SA20 and ILT20.
* There is no further information or update on Pakistani cricketers' participation in MLC.
* The article does not provide any additional details about the MLC tournament itself, such as its schedule, teams, or format.
